snippet: The official N.H.L. statistician said Brad Richards's tying goal in Game 5 came with 7.6 seconds left, not 6.6 seconds left, as it appeared on the television broadcast and as multiple articles reported.
abstract: The official N.H.L. statistician said Brad Richards's tying goal in Game 5 came with 7.6 seconds left, not 6.6 seconds left, as it appeared on the television broadcast and as multiple articles reported.

byline.original: By NAILA-JEAN MEYERS and JEFF Z. KLEIN

headline.main: Just a Second: Timing of Rangers' Goal Is Revisited
